**Subject:** Thank You for Your Inquiry  

**Dear [Recipient’s Name],**  

I hope this message finds you well.  

Thank you for reaching out. I appreciate your interest and am eager to assist you. Please let me know the specifics of your request—whether it involves a proposal, project details, product information, or any other matter—and I will ensure a timely, accurate response.

If you need any further clarification in the meantime, feel free to contact me directly at [Your Email] or call me at [Your Phone Number].  

Looking forward to your reply.  

**Best regards,**  

[Your Full Name]  
[Your Title]  
[Your Organization]  
[Phone] | [Email] | [Website]

**Subject:** Regrettable Unavailability of Requested Assistance  

Dear [Recipient Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I am writing in response to your recent request. Unfortunately, after thorough review, I must advise that I am not able to provide the assistance you’ve outlined at this time.

I understand that this may be disappointing, and I appreciate your understanding. If you would like to discuss alternative solutions or revise the request to align with our security and ethical guidelines, please feel free to contact me at your convenience.

Thank you for your attention, and I look forward to the possibility of working together in the future.

Warm regards,

[Your Full Name]  
[Your Position]  
[Company Name]  
[Contact Information]

1. The purpose or main message of the email (e.g., announcement, request, follow‑up, etc.).

4. Any preferred tone or style guidelines (e.g., formal, friendly, concise, etc.).

Once I have those details, I can craft a secure, professional, and ethically‑sound email draft for you.
